title: "We have restored this installation to an older version of League of Legends."
body:
"We have restored this installation to an older version of League of Legends. Now we'll try to patch it up to the latest version."

Get this message every time I open the client. I can't log in. It doesn't try to patch up to the latest version.
What exactly is the point of telling me this if:
a) I already had the latest patch installed
b) I can't even log in

replies.body:
I've noticed a lot of players having this same issue. I've posted a sticky where we can all share what methods have been working thus far, but here are a couple different things you can try...

- Grab the [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool) and run it with a *Force Repatch*

- Switch your region to force patch, and then switch back after it's done

Hit me back up and let me know if either of these help at all!

Tell people to go to C:>RiotGames>LeagueofLegends> Run the lol.launcher.admin file. It'll do some update or something and when Launch is clicked afterward, people can log in and proceed with _**not losing LP because the client fked up while loading a game.**_
It worked for me.
i did it but it gives me the same error
Dude im getting that shit right now too.
Same
same

FOUND A HOTFIX:
Set the date and time back a day and an hour to fix spaghetti code

Hey dude it works for me, but then after i go into the client already logged in can i change back the time and date??
> [{quoted}](name=PokeRanger69,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=k7xmElhu,comment-id=0008000300040000000200000000,timestamp=2017-08-12T17:32:27.400+0000)
>
> FOUND A HOTFIX:
> Set the date and time back a day and an hour to fix spaghetti code

This is actually working yall, just go into your date and clock and change to yesterday but with 1 hour earlier. :)

No worries, sometimes we just need to do some troubleshooting before we can get to the root cause of the problem. Go ahead and hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), and they'll be able to dig a lot deeper than I can here on the boards!

No worries, I will open a ticket now! So when do we get the LP we lost due to the programming error back? Will your support team be qualified to handle that? Or will I just get the standard automated response instructing me that it is against the Summoner's Code to leave games like that time I got a temporary ban when you guys took the server down for scheduled maintenance while I was in-game?
Same thing with me.

Chronium Embedded Framework (CEF) Client Application has stopped working.
That's me message that appear when I try to Force Repatch
same
fuck this game
I do have the same problem played the like 10 games on the patch then it radomly showed me that message and forced me to restart after that i never got the chance to log in again... great

Same. After like 4 games of urf the client told me that there was a problem patching up to the latest version, and I had to restart the client. Afterwards it said that it restored to a previous version, but it still had the current version's login screen. I pressed ok, but then it said we had trouble patching. It was just an infinite loop of "We have restored this installation to an older version of League" and "There was a problem patching league." The only way I could close the client was going into task manager and closing like 3 instances of League. RITO FIX UR GAEM
Same thing, after like 50 games of urf.

Reinstall takes forever. It just stays at 33% for like 30 minutes
I didn't even fucking play urf this is so fucking annoying
Dude same here! Just happened
So for me I tried to force repatch with the Hextech Repair tool , but the repair tool crash for me and my friend .
why is this happening to me this is bullshit

"We have restored this installation to an older version of League of Legends. Now we'll try to patch it up to the latest version."
I press okay.
"There was a problem patching League of Legends. We'll restore a backup version and try updating again after you restart the patcher.
I press restart 
It goes back to the old message then to the restart message. 
I have done this 10 times repeatedly and it still doesn't go back to normal.
Please do something about this.
